subject: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for Award of Wayside Amenities along National Highways and Expressways- reg.
text: HRdv <rkv TTHf xifetarrut 3414 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 MT (sc WRar- 3 {nf HT4) W4H / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) #f-5 Q 6, #qzr-10, ERaT, T fcri-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAIPolicy Guidelines/ Misc Technical Wayside Amenities /2022 Circular No.18.79 dated 11th March, 2022 [Decision taken on e-office File No: NHAI/ Wayside-Amenities/SOP/2022 (Computer No: 129540)] Sub: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for Award of Wayside Amenities along National Highways and Expressways- reg: 1_ The SOP shall be applicable award of Wayside Amenities along National Highways and Expressways  The procedure for identification of surplus land parcels, finalization of land monetization scheme, invitation of bids, evaluation of bids, acceptance of bids, issuance Of Letter of Acceptance/ Award (LoA) and signing of lease agreement towards development, operation and maintenance of Wayside Amenities is detailed in this SOP . 2 The SOP has been divided into two sections, indicating roles and responsibilities of the following towards development of Wayside Amenities: 2.1 Project Director(s) , PIU and Regional Officer(s) , RO towards identification of surplus land parcels in their jurisdiction; signing of lease agreement with selected entity and further, administering the lease agreement during lease period as per agreed provisions. 2.2 Wayside Amenities Division, Head Office (HO), NHAI towards finalization of monetization scheme, tendering process of WSA sites including invitation, evaluation & acceptance of bids and issuance of Letter of Award to the selected entity. Section I: SOP for RO(s) and PD(s) at Field Offices A. Identification & Reporting of Surplus Land Parcels 3_ With reference to OM dated 25.05.2021 regarding Data Collection for Surplus Land available on NHAI projects (enclosed herewith) and Circular dated   01.07.2021 regarding "Web Form on Datalake for  collecting  information on Surplus Land Available o NHAI projects" (enclosed herewith), all PIUs and ROs are requested to report details of all unused /under-utilized land parcels acquired by NHAI on "Surplus Land Entry Form on Datalake portal: 4_ All ROs/PDs to consider parcels of land falling under below mentioned typology but not limited to: 4,1 Unused /under-utilized land parcels acquired by NHAI in the jurisdiction of PIU. 4.2 Land parcels with 3G is done and is in possession of NHAI. 4.3 Land parcels at interchanges. 4,4 Land parcels left out due to diversion: 4.5 All unused /vacant land that may be monetized in the future for NHAI.
